content: I feel a little called out by this description https://rustacean-principles.netlify.app/how_to_rustacean/pay_it_forward/spreading_knowledge.html and wanted to share.
The "too much" section feels like a direct call-out lol
Heh. As do we all; I wrote that based on so many anecdotes, including my own occasional temptations. (Fortunately, I'm allergic to alpaca.)

You try to suggest that further work in a broader area shouldn't happen because you're too overloaded.

My version of this is "add that to the list of features we can consider if PubGrub lands".
heh, mine is "we can't fix this until rustdoc stops cloning the resolver"
and maybe "doctests are complicated and no I don't feel like working on them"

You propose to give up on the whole area because you don't have time for it.

:upside_down: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/233931-t-compiler.2Fmajor-changes/topic/Don't.20steal.20the.20resolver.20when.20lowering.20HI.E2.80.A6.20compiler-team.23437/near/243796058
The "too much" header doesn't sound like "too much knowledge sharing". It just sounds like an alternative angle of too little knowledge sharing
